column1: animationFrequency@ -1@ Frequency (in number of physical time steps) at which volume output is saved. -1 is at end of simulation
animationFrequencyOffset@ 0@ Offset of phyiscal time step upon animationFrequency at which volume output is saved. e.g. if animationFrequency = 10 and animationFrequencyOffset = 6
column2: the volumetric visualization files will be saved at physical time step = 16

column1: animationFrequencyTimeAverage@ -1@ Frequency (in number of physical time steps) at which time-averaged volume output is saved. -1 is at end of simulation

animationFrequencyTimeAverageOffset@ 0@ Offset of phyiscal time step upon animationFrequencyTimeAverage at which time-averaged volume output is saved. e.g. if animationFrequencyTimeAverage = 10 and animationFrequencyTimeAverageOffset = 6
column2: the time-averaged volumetric visualization files will be saved at physical time step = 16

column1: startAverageIntegrationStep@ 0@ Physical time step to start averaging forces/moments
column2: only if computeTimeAverages is True. Fields that can be averaged: primitiveVars

column1: computeTimeAverages@ FALSE@ Whether or not to compute time-averaged quantities
residualNavierStokes@ FALSE@ 5 components of the N-S residual
residualTurbulence@ FALSE@ Residual for the turbulence model
residualTransition@ FALSE@ Residual for the transition model
solutionTurbulence@ FALSE@ Solution for the turbulence model
solutionTransition@ FALSE@ Solution for the transition model
kOmega@ FALSE@ k and omega when using kOmegaSST model
VelocityRelative@ FALSE@ velocity in rotating frame
betMetrics@ FALSE@ 8 quantities related to BET solvers: velocityX
column2: velocityY and velocityZ in rotating reference frame
column7: local solidity multiplied by integration weight
